intro: Hymenocyclus englerianus, commonly known as the Engler's hymenocystis, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. It typically grows in moist, shady environments such as forests and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
